question: Zero Hunger Programme to be launched from the month of?
explanation: India's ambitious Zero Hunger Programme through interventions in farm sector will be launched on occasion of World Food Day (October 16) with focus on agriculture, nutrition and health in a symbiotic manner. The Programme will be initiated by Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). It consists of organisations of a farming system for nutrition, setting up genetic gardens for biofortified plants and initiation of Zero Hunger training.
